text: {{Infobox writer | name = Paul Auster | image = Paul Auster BBF 2010 Shankbone.jpg | caption = Auster in 2010 | imagesize = | pseudonym = Paul Benjamin | birth_name = Paul Benjamin Auster | birth_date = | birth_place = Newark, New Jersey, U.S. | death_date = | death_place = New York City, New York, U.S. | occupation = | spouse = | children = 2, including Sophie Auster | alma_mater = Columbia University (BA, MA) | period = 1974–2023 | genre = Poetry, literary fiction | subject = | signature = Autograph Auster (cropped).jpg | website = }} Paul Benjamin Auster (February 3, 1947 – April 30, 2024) was an American writer and movie director. His notable works include The New York Trilogy (1987), Moon Palace (1989), The Music of Chance (1990), The Book of Illusions (2002), The Brooklyn Follies (2005), Invisible (2009), Sunset Park (2010), Winter Journal (2012), and 4 3 2 1 (2017). In December 2022, Auster was diagnosed with lung cancer. He died of problems caused by the disease at his home in New York City, on April 30, 2024, at the age of 77. ==References== ==Other websites== * * * * 'The Searcher', interview with The Guardian in May 1999 Category:1947 births Category:2024 deaths Category:American novelists Category:American poets Category:American translators Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:Movie directors from New Jersey Category:Movie directors from New York City Category:Writers from Newark, New Jersey Category:Writers from New York City
